title: Chevening Scholarships

basic_info.description: Chevening Scholarships are the UK government's global scholarship program, funded by the Foreign and Commonwealth Office and partner organisations.

tuition.notes: Covers full tuition fees for eligible one-year master's programmes.

living_allowance.notes: Stipend for accommodation and living costs, varies slightly by city.

travel.notes: One economy-class return airfare to and from the UK.

health_insurance.notes: Visa application costs and NHS surcharge are the applicant's responsibility.

books_materials.notes: Includes arrival allowance and thesis grant.

total_value.notes: Total value varies based on tuition fees.

documents.name: Leadership and Influence Essay
documents.description: Describe your leadership and influencing skills

steps.title: Online Application & Essays
steps.description: Submit online application with four essays on leadership, networking, study plan, and career goals.

steps.title: Sifting & Shortlisting
steps.description: Applications are assessed against eligibility criteria by independent reading committees.

steps.title: Interview
steps.description: Shortlisted candidates are invited for an in-person interview at the local British embassy or high commission.

steps.title: Conditional Offer
steps.description: Successful interviewees receive a conditional offer and must secure an unconditional offer from a UK university.

success_tips: Demonstrate clear leadership potential with concrete examples
Show strong networking abilities and social impact
Connect your career goals with UK-Indonesia relations
Research UK universities and programs thoroughly
common_mistakes: Failing to provide specific examples in essays (using the STAR method helps).
Not meeting the minimum work experience requirement.
Choosing university courses that are not eligible for Chevening funding.
A weak or generic career plan.
